DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator related to assessment of clot formation in blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to assessment of clot formation in blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:The process of clot formation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The process of clot formation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.3 x institutional ULN?  Patients receiving anticoagulation treatment may be allowed to participate with INR established within the therapeutic range prior to randomization.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study Prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.2 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless subject is receiving anticoagulant therapy not requiring laboratory monitoring as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study INR less than or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or PT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal seconds above control unless patient is currently receiving warfarin therapy for the treatment or prevention of venous thrombosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.4?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International Normalized Ratio (INR) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test greater than or equal to 1.3 x the laboratory upper limit of normal within 7 days prior to the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study PTT less than or equal to 40 seconds unless due to lupus coagulant?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT/INR and PTT less than 1.3 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study prothrombin time or INR less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) and PT less than or equal to 1.2 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study prothrombin time or INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.3 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR, aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT/INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed or except patients on anticoagulation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, are pre-study INR and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.4 unless the patient is receiving therapeutic doses of Coumadin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International Normalized Ratio (INR) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test greater than or equal to 1.5 x the laboratory upper limit of normal within 7 days prior to the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study aPTT and PT less than to 1.2 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN), OR International normalized ratio (INR) less than 1.5?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR and aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN unless patient is on anticoagulant therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: If receiving patient is receiving warfarin, is INR less than or equal to 3.0 without any evidence of active bleeding within 14 days prior to first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN), OR International normalized ratio (INR) less than 1.5?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving warfarin, is INR less than or equal to 3.0 without any evidence of active bleeding within 14 days prior to first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study aPTT and PT greater than or equal to 1.2 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study aPTT and PT less than or equal to 1.2 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR and aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed or except pateints on anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study international normalized ratio (INR) or prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) or activated PTT (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are screening visit International normalized ratio (INR) and aPartial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study PTT or APTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT and aPTT less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal, unless thought to be related to the underlying disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are both PT and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, unless thought to be related to the underlying disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than 1.3 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless subject is receiving anticoagulant therapy as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study Prothrombin time (PT) and aPartial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, are International Normalized Ratio (INR) or prothrombin time (PT) or activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR if patient is receiving therapeutic anticoagulation is patient on a stable dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is therapeutically treated with anticoagulation including warfarin, is the patient`s medication dose and INR/PTT stable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study international normalized ratio (INR) or prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) or activated PTT (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN, unless patient is on a stable dose of anti-coagulation therapy which will be allowed to participate if they have no signs of bleeding or clotting and the INR/PT and PTT/aPTT results are compatible with an acceptable risk-benefit ratio as per the investigator's discretion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN), OR is International normalized ratio (INR) less than 1.5?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT and PTT within the institutional normal limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 57
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is International normalized ratio (INR)/Prothrombin time (PT) and either partial thromboplastin or activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 × ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 59
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.3 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 60
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than 1.5?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 58
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 61
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, is International normalized ratio (INR) greater than or equal to 1.5 (or greater than therapeutic range if patient is receiving warfarin),  PTT greater than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 62
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study International Normalized ratio  (INR)/Prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days of randomization/enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT/INR and aPTT within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed or the patient is on direct oral anticoagulant (DOA)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 63
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is INR and either PTT or aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study International Normalized Ratio (INR) less than or equal to 1.5 and no clinically significant bleeding event within the past six months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 64
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, are pre-study PT/aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless subject is receiving anticoagulant therapy as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants, within 3 days prior to the first day of 7+3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 67
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study INR or PT and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 66
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PTT (or aPTT) and INR less than or equal to 1.5 institutional ULN (except for patients receiving anticoagulation therapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 65
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 68
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation that may affect INR, are International Normalized ratio (INR)/Prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 14 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 69
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study International normalized ratio (INR) or prothrombin time (PT): less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 70
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless participant is receiving anticoagulant therapy, in which case PT or aPTT should be within expected therapeutic range of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 71
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation are INR and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN or if patient is receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, such as low-molecular-weight heparin or warfarin, patient is on a stable dose?
